final_answer.precision_note: Inputs are given to 3 s.f.; report the diluted concentration to 3 s.f. (0.0200 mol dm-3).

method: Use the dilution relationship c1V1 = c2V2. The initial acid has c1 = 0.200 mol dm-3 and volume V1 = 25.0 cm3, diluted to final volume V2 = 250.0 cm3. Because both volumes are in cm3, the units cancel in the ratio V1/V2. Rearrange to c2 = c1 × V1/V2 = 0.200 × (25.0/250.0) = 0.200 × 0.100 = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
checks: Volume increases by a factor of 10 (25.0 → 250.0 cm3), so concentration should fall by 10×: 0.200/10 = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
